intro: Fuchsia ravenii, commonly known as the velvet tangerine fuchsia, is a striking evergreen shrub native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green foliage and clusters of vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from deep red to orange. The plant produces small, edible berries that are rich in flavor and often used in local cuisines. Fuchsia ravenii thrives in cool, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
